item.title: Ethereum Hits $1.5 Billion Market Cap amid Bitcoin Surge
item.description:
Ethereum Hits $1.5 Billion Market Cap amid Bitcoin Surge

It is positive to see multiple cryptocurrencies faring well at the same time. Bitcoin and Ethereum are not competing with each other by any means, and they can peacefully co-exist. Amidst all of the Bitcoin craze, people would almost forget Ethereum is doing extremely well at the same time.

item.title: From Ethereum Virtual Machine to Bitcoin Blockchain: Questions raised by Counterparty
item.description:
From Ethereum Virtual Machine to Bitcoin Blockchain: Questions raised by Counterparty

Is this the beginning of the end of Ethereum? That's the question posed in a Bitcoin subreddit devoted to new information and discussion about Bitcoin and its ecosystem. The comment comes after the announcement by Counterparty that it is porting the Ethereum Virtual Machine to the Bitcoin Blockchain.

item.title: US Federal Appeals Court: Seizure of Debit Card Funds is Constitutional
item.description:
US Federal Appeals Court: Seizure of Debit Card Funds is Constitutional

A federal court has upheld the right of police to seize and retain funds on debit and credit cards, be they prepaid or otherwise.

item.title: Bitcoin Is Not about Undermining the Government, but Promoting Humanity - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Is Not about Undermining the Government, but Promoting Humanity - NEWSBTC

There is a debate that Bitcoin can eliminate government's oversight to make people more financially independent. However, the true potential of Bitcoin, if used effectively promotes humanity that transcends all geographical differences. We have all been keeping an eye on the bitcoin price in the recent days.

item.title: Ethereum Support In USD and EUR Markets Is On The Rise
item.description:
Ethereum Support In USD and EUR Markets Is On The Rise

Ethereum is wrecking the trading charts over the past few days, and the cryptocurrency seems to hold its own compared to Bitcoin. A few good spikes in trading volume will certainly help, and both USD and EUR markets continue to heat up.

item.title: Meanwhile in Asia: Cryptotechnologies and Economies
item.description:
Meanwhile in Asia: Cryptotechnologies and Economies

Cryptoeconomy becomes more and more entwined with the traditional one. Beginning as a crypto-anarchist utopia, the ecosystem keeps on evolving, and currently it starts influencing what happens in the big financial world. In this brief overview, we'll attempt to show how it happens in Asia.

item.title: 5 reasons Bitcoin price is rising | HolyTransaction
item.description:
5 reasons Bitcoin price is rising | HolyTransaction

The bitcoin price keeps rising and it is reaching the value of $700, growing more than 20% during the weekend. Today, in fact, the Bitcoin price is $695, according to Coindesk and it seems it doesn't want to turn back. Experts are trying to provide several reasons for this rise, including the Chinese Domain and the halving of miners rewards.

item.title: What's the best place to buy ethereum for USD?
item.description:
What's the best place to buy ethereum for USD?

Ummm... let me see if I understand the suggestion. To paraphrase, we should achieve greater action on one of the major issues facing the world today by removing it from the agendas of both political parties in the most powerful country in the world. Yeah, that makes sense.

item.title: Brazil Trumps US In Fight Against Payment Card Fraud
item.description:
Brazil Trumps US In Fight Against Payment Card Fraud

When it comes to dealing with payment card transactions, fraud remains one of the key concerns for all retailers. Brazil has adapted to this challenge by introducing EMV payments back in 2011, as well as other fraud prevention tools. This same technology is only now rolling out to customers in the US, five years after the facts.

item.title: 5 Factors Experts Say Drove Bitcoin's Rise to $700 - CoinDesk
item.description:
5 Factors Experts Say Drove Bitcoin's Rise to $700 - CoinDesk

Bitcoin surged close to 20% over the weekend spanning 11th June and 12th June, and this robust appreciation grabbed the attention of many experts who were quick to give their two cents on what fueled the rally.
